newsitem.title: USA: Time Warner chief Levin's son found dead.
newsitem.headline: Time Warner chief Levin's son found dead.

text.p: Media giant Time Warner Inc confirmed on Tuesday that the body found in a Manhattan apartment was that of Jonathan Levin, son of company chairman Gerald Levin.

The badly decomposed body was discovered in Levin's Columbus Avenue apartment at about 10:30 p.m. EDT on Monday (0230 GMT Tuesday), a police spokeswoman said. The body was bound and gagged but there were no visible stab or gunshot wounds, she added.
"We are shocked and saddened by the death of Jonathan Levin," Time Warner President Richard Parsons said on Tuesday.
Levin, a 34-year-old English teacher at Taft High School in the Bronx, did not turn up for work on Monday, school officials said.
A police spokeswoman said other teachers who lived in the same building had called police after one of them, who had a key to Levin's apartment, found the body on Monday night.
A dog was found locked in Levin's bedroom, she said.
Gerald Levin took over as chairman of Time Warner in 1992, replacing Nicholas Nicholas. Time Warner was formed by the 1989 merger of Time and Warner communications.
